title: Typophile to speak at Chronicle Books' 555 design event
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019135740im_/http:/typophile.com/files/typ_idm_040zennua3sa0z_main_pic_1252537862_5926.jpg)

Chronicle Books Design is hosting "5 Speakers / 5 Minutes / 5 Questions"; an evening of design-minded conversation and drinks, featuring five bloggers currently reporting on our visual world:

1 **Dave Cuzner** / [http://grainedit.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019135740/http:/grainedit.com/ "http://grainedit.com")  
GrainEdit is focused on classic design work from the 1950s-1970s and contemporary designers that draw inspiration from that time period.

2 **[Joe Pemberton](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019135740/http:/josephpemberton.com/)** / [http://www.typophile.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019135740/http:/www.typophile.com/ "http://www.typophile.com")  
Typophile is the end all, be all internet forum for typography lovers. It's a "gig" owned by Punchcut.

3 **Suzanne LaGasa** / [http://www.chroniclebooks.com/blog/?cat=41](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019135740/http:/www.chroniclebooks.com/blog/?cat=41 "http://www.chroniclebooks.com/blog/?cat=41")  
Design Desk is the regular feature on Chronicles' blog written by the in-house designers.

4 **Lauren Smith and Derek Fagerstrom** / [http://smartsandcrafts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019135740/http:/smartsandcrafts.com/ "http://smartsandcrafts.com")  
Smarts&Crafts is the blog component of the Curiosity Shoppe, an impeccably curated store focused on all things crafty, arty, or well designed.

5 **David Pescovitz** / [http://boingboing.net](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019135740/http:/boingboing.net/ "http://boingboing.net")  
A moderated culture blog whose main contributors were or are still involved with Wired magazine.
author: Joe Pemberton
